com.gtp.hunter.rfid.asciiprotocol.responders

Class TransponderResponder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gtp.hunter.rfid.asciiprotocol.responders.TransponderResponder

  • public class TransponderResponder
extends java.lang.Object
    Processes responses looking for transponder header and collects into a transponder. Calls the TransponderReceivedHandler for each transponder received

    Captures the EP CR PC RI responses to form a TransponderData instance. Captures WW as WordsWritten and RD as data read Captures OK ER to raise TransponderReceived at the end of a response;

    The delegate is called if: - A new EPC is received and the current EPC is valid (moreAvailable = true). Just received the EPC of the next response - OK or ER is received and the current EPC is valid (moreAvailable = false). End of the command - TransponderComplete is called. This is provided for when a base class handles OR or ER and needs to complete a transponder

      • processReceivedLine

        public final boolean processReceivedLine(java.lang.String header,
                          java.lang.String value)
        Each correctly terminated line from the device is passed to this method for processing
        Parameters:
        header - The response line header excluding the colon e.g. 'CS' for a command started response
        value - The response line following the colon e.g. '.iv'
        Returns:
        Return true if this line should NOT be passed to any other responder.

      • transponderComplete

        public final void transponderComplete(boolean moreAvailable)
        When called this method checks to see if the Epc is not empty. If the EPC is valid then OnTransponderComplete if called to notify the delegate of the transponder received. Once called the response is reset with ClearLastResponse
        Parameters:
        moreAvailable - True if more transponders are pending to be notified
